conclusion: Analyze motion of rods on inclined rails with magnetic field and forces using electromagnetic induction, Newton's laws, and energy conservation.
Rods a and b are moving on inclined rails with angle Œ∏ = 30¬∞.
Uniform magnetic field B = 0.2 T is directed vertically upward.
Rod a is subjected to constant force F = 2 N parallel to the rails.
Rod a has mass m_a = 0.3 kg and rod b has mass m_b = 0.1 kg.
Both rods have resistance R = 0.1 Œ©.
As rods move, they cut through magnetic field lines, inducing EMF given by ùìî = B ‚ãÖ L ‚ãÖ v.
Power dissipated as Joule heat in rod a is P_a = ùìî_a^2 / R.
Find time t during which heat is generated: Q_a = P_a ‚ãÖ t ‚áí 0.12 = 0.1 ‚ãÖ t ‚áí t = 1.2 s.
Net force on rod a: F_net,a = F - m_a g sin Œ∏ - B I_a L.
Induced current I_a = ùìî_a / R = B L v_a / R.
Net force on rod b: F_net,b = m_b g sin Œ∏ - B I_b L.
Induced current I_b = ùìî_b / R = B L v_b / R.
Velocities v_a and v_b are related due to energy conservation and circuit connection.
Mechanical energy lost by rod a is converted into kinetic energy of both rods and Joule heating.
Using v_a = 1.0 m/s and system constraints, deduce velocities are such that induced EMFs are equal: B L v_a = B L v_b.
